The plant has a thalloid structure, with a flattened, ribbon-like body that is covered in small, scale-like leaves. It typically grows on rocks or soil in temperate regions, and it plays a role in soil stabilization and moisture retention. Mollia stellata is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to thrive in challenging conditions.
